meanings.definition: To cause intense fear or dread in someone.
meanings.sent1: The haunted house torrified the visitors with its spooky decorations.
meanings.sent2: The horror movie was so torrifying that I had to cover my eyes.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a ghost party torrified the little girl, but then she giggled at the thought.
meanings.sent4: The dark shadows torrified her mind like a never-ending nightmare.
meanings.sent5: The sudden thunderstorm was torrifying, making everyone jump in fright.

meanings.sent1: The torrifying sound of the howling wind kept me awake all night.
meanings.sent2: The abandoned house had a torrifying atmosphere that sent shivers down my spine.
meanings.sent3: The torrifying clown costume made everyone laugh nervously at the party.
meanings.sent4: The torrifying silence in the forest felt like a heavy weight on my chest.
meanings.sent5: The torrifying news of the monster sighting spread quickly through the town.
